snippet: In addition to those organized against members of specific cultural backgrounds, an Alabama law center also noted a rise in antigovernment groups.
abstract: Report by the Southern Poverty Law Center finds that the number of so-called hate groups and antigovernment organizations in the nation has continued to grow, rising to 1,018 from 602 in 2000; group holds that rise has been fueled by antagonism toward President Obama, resentment toward changing racial demographics and the economic rift between rich and poor.
lead_paragraph: In addition to those organized against members of specific cultural backgrounds, an Alabama law center also noted a rise in antigovernment groups.
